availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip Tomppert, Jr. (Louisville, Kentucky, city court clerk)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, court clerk. Kentucky native. Son of Philip Tomppert and Margaret Tomppert. Married to Henrietta Reuning Tomppert in Louisville, Kentucky, on December 3, 1861. Father of Louis P. Tomppert and Eugenia E. Tomppert. Student in Louisville in 1850. Interpreter of the City Court in Louisville in 1861. Clerk of the Louisville City Court in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 1, p. 19B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 1, p. 104.
"Board of Aldermen: Joint Session," Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), October 19, 1861, p. 1.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 26078.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482709, p. 82.
“Philip Tomppert Dead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), December 23, 1895, p. 8.
"J. Phillip Tomppert, Jr (1839-1895)," Find A Grave, Memorial 155379750, accessed October 25, 2019, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/155379750.
